review_text: The Course was very well prepared but in some categories the quiz questions was not related. Also  for a total beginner some operations and things will be hard. Need more details and tool explanations. But overall the course is great! I know this instructor for a long time and it was nice  and refreshing to take this course again!
i am working on photoshop from quite of years and knows the basics very well but the way dan teaches is just awesome ultimately this course is worth the money and time.
Dan is Just Awesome as a trainer. I loved his way of teaching. I am gonna buy his another Photoshop Tutorial
Very helpful

Dan is a great tutor. I had taken his course for Adobe Photoshop Fundamentals, just to test Fiverr's new platform - but honestly, Dan's course helped me straighten my graphic design skills, learn a lot of new shortcuts, and some features that I have missed in the past. Definitely, I will be signing up for his "PS Mastery" course, and for his Illustrator ones over the span of the next couple of months. Thanks Dan, I will be sure to follow you across social media for the latest updates.
Excellent course for anyone and especially for any beginners.  Thank you, Dan!

Thank you so much I am so happy!

I can't think of enough good reasons why you should start this course. First of all, it's not expensive at all. Second of all, it gives you a great understanding of what Photoshop does and how it works. Third, it helps with Fiverr gigs, allowing you to create custom thumbnails, just like I did. Fourth, Dan is entertaining and makes learning less of a chore than it actually is. Fifth, the effects and tools used (except a few ones) are relevant and usable on many different projects. Sixth ... You see where I'm going with this? "Learn." is the best thing that Fiverr came up with recently. Money for them, better profiles and ranking for us, and an overall knowledge gain. Go for it, now!

This is a great course. However, it is ridiculous that you have to go through the videos in order and take the test before going on to the next section.

If you want to go back and review a video, a week later,  you have to go through the whole sections again. No skipping around. It's like taking a test at the DMV or an online test at traffic school 

Very disappointed, I will go back to Linkin Learning.
